sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A letter written by a French Catholike gentleman, to the maisters at Sorbonne. Concerning the late victories obtained by the king of Nauarre, aswell against the Duke of Ioyeuse at Coutras vpon Tuesday the twentieth of October, 1587. as els where Mornay, Philippe de, seigneur du Plessis-Marly, 1549-1623.
78, [2] p.
Printed by Iohn Wolfe for Edward Aggas, and are to be sold at his shope at the West end of Paules, London : 1588.
Attributed by STC to Philippe de Mornay. Includes, at end, "The King of Nauars song after his victorie". Some print show-through,. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
A letter written by a French Catholike gentleman, to the maisters at Sorbonne. Concerning the late victories obtained by the king of Nauarre, aswell against the Duke of Ioyeuse at Coutras vpon Tuesday the twentieth of October, 1587. as els where Mornay, Philippe de, seigneur du Plessis-Marly, 1549-1623.
78, [2] p.
Printed by Iohn Wolfe for Edward Aggas, and are to be sold at his shope at the West end of Paules, London : 1588.
Attributed by STC to Philippe de Mornay. Includes, at end, "The King of Nauars song after his victorie". Some print show-through,. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
Edward Aggas
Iohn Wolfe
his shope at the West end of Paules
